title: Michel Foucault - Selected Works (25 books)
description:
A collection of 25 books, including several anthologies, by Michel Foucault (1926-1984), the prolific French philosopher, social theorist, historian of ideas, and literary critic. 

Foucault's philosophical theories addressed the nature of power and the manner in which it functions, the means by which it controls knowledge and vice versa, and how it is used as a form of social control. Foucault is best known for his critical studies of social institutions, most notably psychiatry, the social anthropology of medicine, the human sciences, the prison system, and the history of human sexuality. His writings on power, knowledge, and discourse have been widely influential in academic circles.

All of the following books are in PDF format:

* The Archaeology of Knowledge (Routledge, 2002)

* The Birth of Biopolitics: Lectures at the CollÃƒÂ¨ge de France, 1978-79 (Palgrave, 2008)
* The Birth of the Clinic: An Archaeology of Medical Perception (Routledge, 2003)

* The Courage of Truth: Lectures at the CollÃƒÂ¨ge de France, 1983-84 (Palgrave, 2011)

* Death and the Labyrinth: The World of Raymond Roussel (Continuum, 2007)
* Discipline and Punish: The Birth of the Prison (Vintage, 1995)

* Essential Works, Vol. 1: Ethics, Subjectivity and Truth (New Press, 1997)
* Essential Works, Vol. 2: Aesthetics, Method and Epistemology (New Press, 1998)
* Essential Works, Vol. 3: Power (New Press, 2001)

* Foucault Reader [ed. Paul Rabinow] (Pantheon, 1984)

* The History of Sexuality, Vol. 2: The Uses of Pleasure (Pantheon, 1985)
* The History of Sexuality, Vol. 3: The Care of the Self (Pantheon, 1986)

* Introduction to Kant's Anthropology (Semiotext(e), 2008)

* Manet and the Object of Painting (Tate, 2009)

* The Order of Things: An Archaeology of the Human Sciences (Routledge, 1989)

* Politics of Truth (Semiotext(e), 2007)
* Politics, Philosophy, Culture: Interviews & Other Writings, 1977-1984 (Routledge, 1988)
* Power/Knowledge: Selected Interviews & Other Writings, 1972-1977 (Pantheon, 1980)
* Psychiatric Power: Lectures at the CollÃƒÂ¨ge de France, 1973-74 (Palgrave, 2006)

* Remarks on Marx (Semiotext(e), 1991)

* "Society Must Be Defended": Lectures at the CollÃƒÂ¨ge de France, 1975-76 (Picador, 2003)

* This is Not a Pipe (University of California Press, 1983)
